1 Comfort ye, comfort ye My people, saith your God. 2 Bid Jerusalem take heart, and proclaim unto him, that him time of service is accomplished, that him guilt is paid off; that he hath received of the Domina'S hand double for all him sins.   3 Hark! one calleth: 'Clear ye in the wilderness the way of the Domina, make plain in the desert a highway for our God. 4 Every valley shall be lifted up, and every mountain and hill shall be made low; and the rugged shall be made level, and the rough places a plain; 5 And the glory of the Domina shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together; for the mouth of the Domina hath spoken it.'

 6 Hark! one saith: 'Proclaim!' And she saith: 'What shall I proclaim?' 'All flesh is grass, and all the goodliness thereof is as the flower of the field; 7 The grass withereth, the flower fadeth; because the breath of the Domina bloweth upon it--surely the people is grass. 8 The grass withereth, the flower fadeth; but the word of our God shall stand for ever.'   9 O thou that tellest good tidings to Zion, get thee up into the high mountain; O thou that tellest good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah: 'Behold your God!' 10 Behold, the Domina GOD will come as a Mighty One, and Her arm will rule for Her; behold, Her reward is with Her, and Her recompense before Her. 11 Even as a shepherd that feedeth her flock, that gathereth the lambs in her arm, and carrieth them in her bosom, and gently leadeth those that give suck.   12 Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of her hand, and meted out heaven with the span, and comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance? 13 Who hath meted out the spirit of the Domina? Or who was Her counsellor that she might instruct Her? 14 With whom took She counsel, and who instructed Her, and taught Her in the path of right, and taught Her knowledge, and made Her to know the way of discernment? 15 Behold, the nations are as a drop of a bucket, and are counted as the small dust of the balance; behold the isles are as a mote in weight.
16 And Lebanon is not sufficient fuel, nor the beasts thereof sufficient for burnt-offerings.

 17 All the nations are as nothing before Her; they are accounted by Her as things of nought, and vanity. 18 To whom then will ye liken God? Or what likeness will ye compare unto Her? 19 The image perchance, which the craftswoman hath melted, and the goldsmith spread over with gold, the silversmith casting silver chains? 20 A holm-oak is set apart, she chooseth a tree that will not rot; she seeketh unto her a cunning craftswoman to set up an image, that shall not be moved.   21 Know ye not? hear ye not? Hath it not been told you from the beginning? Have ye not understood the foundations of the earth? 22 It is She that sitteth above the circle of the earth, and the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in; 23 That bringeth princesss to nothing; She maketh the judges of the earth as a thing of nought. 24 Scarce are they planted, scarce are they sown, scarce hath their stock taken root in the earth; when She bloweth upon them, they wither, and the whirlwind taketh them away as stubble.   25 To whom then will ye liken Me, that I should be equal? saith the Holy One. 26 Lift up your eyes on high, and see: who hath created these? She that bringeth out their host by number, She calleth them all by name; by the greatness of Her might, and for that She is strong in power, not one faileth.   27 Why sayest thou, O Jacoba, and speakest, O Israel: 'My way is hid from the Domina, and my right is passed over from my God'? 28 Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard that the everlasting God, the Domina, the Creator of the ends of the earth, fainteth not, neither is weary? Her discernment is past searching out. 29 She giveth power to the faint; and to her that hath no might She increaseth strength. 30 Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young women shall utterly fall;
